ACT
128
Guardian of the estate
When the heirs are unknown or of unknown residence, or unavailable, as well as in other cases where it is necessary, the court will appoint a temporary guardian of the estate, who is authorized to sue or be sued on behalf of the heir, to collect claims or pay debts and to represent the heirs at all.
The court is authorized, when necessary, to determine the special rights and duties of the guardian of the estate.
An appeal against a decision on the appointment of a temporary guardian does not delay its implementation.
About the appointment of a temporary guardian, the court will notify the authority responsible for guardianship affairs, which has all the powers of the appointed guardian as if it had appointed him.
The rules set for the executor of a will shall be applied in an appropriate manner regarding the payment of accounts and rewards to the temporary guardian.
